timeline.bodyText: This method tests wait time with both same node and other node failover.  I think these should be separate test cases, both for independence and to match test method name.

timeline.bodyText: It seems this is basically the same test case as testWaitTimeResetWhenNextNodeFailoverAfterSameNode.  If you agree, I think we can drop this one.
timeline.author: adoroszlai

timeline.bodyText:
A couple of test cases depend on this value by attempting 2 failovers to next node.  I think it should be a member variable and tests should use failoverToNextNode(numNodes - 1, 0) instead of failoverToNextNode(2, 0).
Note that failoverToSameNode(2) should be kept as is, since in that case the failover number is arbitrary.
timeline.author: adoroszlai

replies.bodyText:
Hay Attila, Thanks for reviews. It make sense to make it member variable. I remember I extracted it for the purpose and lost that. BTW, that variable should be int, not long. Just updated that too.
Take a look.
And the pr test failures seems unrelated, I had a quick look.
replies.author: umamaheswararao

timeline.bodyText: We are updating lastAttemptedOM to the new OM which will be tried after failover. The assignment should happen before the currentProxyOMNodeId is updated with newLeaderOMNodeId.
timeline.author: hanishakoneru

replies.bodyText: @hanishakoneru good catch. I added new test to cover this case too. Please take a look at it.
